intro: Klattia stokoei, commonly known as the Stokoe's klattia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Klattia stokoei is known for its compact growth habit and is often found in small clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
